TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and resident in GPE .
The following is a summary of the proceedings :

On DATE the applicant lodged a civil action against his wife , her sister and her brother - in - law with the Warszawa- ORG , claiming repossession of an apartment of which he and his wife were co - owners , and from which he had allegedly been unlawfully evicted in DATE .

In their reply of DATE the defendants requested the court to dismiss the applicant ’s action and contended that he had never lived in the apartment and had never intended to make it his principal residence .
A first hearing in the case was held in DATE .
In DATE , CARDINAL hearings were fixed in the case .
In DATE , CARDINAL hearings were fixed .

Some of those hearings were adjourned , either as the parties were ( justifiably ) absent , or because the court had not received postal confirmation that summonses had been properly served on them . Certain adjournments were necessary in order to summon certain witnesses proposed by the parties at the hearings . The court also adjourned certain hearings in order to request various authorities to submit files of cases pending before judicial or prosecution bodies which the parties deemed necessary for the accurate determination of their claims . Thus , the parties lodged motions to have CARDINAL files of investigations pending before the prosecutor submitted to the court . Likewise , the parties requested that a file of administrative proceedings pending before ORG of the Warszawa - Wola District Office be submitted to the court . They further requested that the case - file of the applicant ’s divorce proceedings , instituted in DATE , be submitted to the court .

In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the Warszawa - Wola District Prosecutor informed the court that the case - file of CARDINAL of the criminal cases could not be submitted to the court as the file had been transmitted to ORG following the applicant ’s appeal against a particular decision .
On DATE the court heard evidence from the parties and adjourned the hearing , as certain files had not yet been submitted to the court .
In DATE and DATE CARDINAL hearings were fixed DATE .

In his pleadings of DATE the applicant stated that the defendant had sold the apartment concerned . He reiterated this statement at the hearing of DATE . The court adjourned the hearing and requested the housing co - operative to submit the documents concerning the apartment .

On DATE the defendant requested the court to stay the proceedings as , according to the co - operative ’s letter of CARDINAL DATE , it had been the defendant who had an exclusive right to the apartment , governed by the legal provisions on housing co - operatives . She further informed the court that on CARDINAL DATE the applicant had brought a civil action against her , requesting that the contract of sale of the apartment be declared null and void .
In DATE , CARDINAL hearing was held .
In DATE , the applicant unsuccessfully requested that the presiding judge step down .

In DATE , CARDINAL hearings were held before FAC . In DATE , the applicant once again requested that the presiding judge step down , alleging lack of impartiality on his part . His request was refused as it did not comply with the applicable legal requirements .

In DATE , the court was to hold CARDINAL hearings . The first hearing was adjourned on DATE , the court apparently not having received confirmation that the summonses had been served on the parties . Likewise the hearing on DATE was adjourned .
On DATE ORG again dismissed the applicant ’s challenge of CARDINAL of the judges and imposed a fine on him , considering that his request that the judge step down had been submitted in bad faith .
The hearing fixed for DATE was adjourned , as the court had not received confirmation of proper service of certain summonses .
In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE the ORG ordered repossession of the apartment of which the applicant was a co - owner and from which he had been evicted by his wife in DATE .
On DATE ORG confirmed the judgment , which , accordingly , became final .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim for annulment of the sale contract of the apartment .
Subsequently , upon the GPE request , on DATE the Minister of ORG lodged an extraordinary appeal with ORG against the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE ORG set aside the impugned judgment and dismissed the applicant ’s claim , considering that the action for repossession had become devoid of purpose as in DATE the defendant had sold the apartment concerned .
Relevant domestic law

LAW provides that a possessor can apply to a court for repossession against a person who has deprived him of de facto possession , regardless of whether he or she is a bona fide possessor or whether the factual possession is in conformity with the law .

Articles CARDINAL to CARDINAL of LAW , as applicable at the material time , provided that an extraordinary appeal could be lodged against any final judicial decision with ORG by the Minister of Justice - the Prosecutor General , the President of ORG and the ORG . An extraordinary appeal could be lodged on the ground that the decision was in flagrant breach of the law . A party to the proceedings could file a request to have such an appeal lodged with these authorities on his or her behalf . ORG , having examined the extraordinary appeal at a public hearing , could dismiss it if no grounds for allowing it had been established . If the extraordinary appeal was allowed , ORG could set the decision under appeal aside and rule on the merits of the case , or reject the claim and discontinue the proceedings .
